description: Confirmed continuation of large-scale purchases of up to $100 billion in GSE debt and up to $500 billion in agency-guaranteed mortgage-backed securities
justification: These large-scale asset purchases represent unconventional monetary policy designed to provide substantial accommodation by lowering longer-term interest rates and supporting mortgage markets.

description: Reduced interest rates on required and excess reserves to 1/4 percent
justification: This reduction supports the zero lower bound policy by providing a floor for the federal funds rate and represents accommodative policy through the interest on reserves mechanism.

description: Reduced the discount rate by 75 basis points to 1/2 percent
justification: A substantial reduction in the discount rate that supports the overall accommodative stance and maintains the traditional spread relationship with the federal funds rate.

description: Established a target range for the federal funds rate of 0 to 1/4 percent
justification: This represents the most accommodative conventional monetary policy possible, bringing rates to the zero lower bound for the first time in the Fed's modern history.

description: Adopted communication strategy to sustain the Federal Reserve's balance sheet at a high level through various policy measures
justification: This communication signals the Fed's commitment to maintaining accommodative policy through balance sheet expansion, representing a clear dovish signal about future policy intentions.

description: Announced evaluation of potential benefits of purchasing longer-term Treasury securities
justification: While not a commitment to action, this communication signals the Fed's willingness to consider additional unconventional accommodation measures, providing a mildly dovish signal.

description: Provided forward guidance that weak economic conditions are likely to warrant exceptionally low levels of the federal funds rate for some time
justification: This conditional forward guidance provides accommodation by signaling the Fed's intention to keep rates low for an extended period, helping to lower longer-term interest rate expectations.

description: Confirmed implementation of the Term Asset-Backed Securities Loan Facility (TALF) early next year
justification: The TALF represents an additional unconventional policy tool designed to support credit markets and provide accommodation by facilitating lending to households and small businesses.

description: Committed to continue considering ways of using the Federal Reserve's balance sheet to support credit markets and economic activity
justification: This open-ended commitment signals the Fed's willingness to deploy additional unconventional tools as needed, providing a mildly accommodative signal about future policy flexibility.
